answerText: cis[10] Using the Cahn-Ingold-Prelog priority rules, this letter designates a configuration across a double bond in which the highest-order substituents are on the same side.
heading: Penn Bowl |2012 | 7 | 6 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This term, in genetics, is used to describe regulatory elements that act on the same strand of DNA that they are located on. For 10 points each: [10] Identify this word, which describes a configuration across a double bond in which two substituents are on the same side. It is often contrasted with the trans configuration.
